title: Fix VAT Category dropdown visibility and z-index issues

requirements.summary: Apply CSS fix to resolve VAT Category dropdown being overshadowed by implementing z-index hierarchy and overflow visibility for parent containers
acceptanceCriteria: VAT Category dropdown in Transaction tab is fully visible and not overshadowed by elements below
Dropdown menu displays with proper z-index layering above all other content
All parent containers (tabs, tab-content, grid, column, card) have overflow: visible applied
Select element has position: relative and z-index: 9999

file_operations.description: Add master dropdown fix CSS rules including universal overflow: visible, select element positioning with z-index: 9999, dropdown-menu z-index: 99999, and overflow: visible for tabs, tab-content, grid, column, and card classes to ensure VAT Category dropdown is fully visible and layered correctly above all other elements

requirements.summary: Limit VAT Category dropdown visible items to maximum 3 options at a time with scrolling enabled for remaining options
acceptanceCriteria: VAT Category dropdown shows maximum 3 visible items when opened
Remaining category options are accessible via vertical scrolling within the dropdown
Dropdown height is constrained to display exactly 3 items
Scroll behavior is smooth and intuitive for users

file_operations.description: Add max-height constraint to VAT Category select element to display exactly 3 visible items with overflow-y: auto for scrolling through remaining options, ensuring smooth vertical scrolling behavior within the dropdown
